谢尔盖·罗斯林 Sergei Russkin
安德烈·克拉斯科 Andrey Krasko

writer.name: 亚历山大·罗戈日金 Aleksandr Rogozhkin

director.name: 亚历山大·罗戈日金 Aleksandr Rogozhkin

introduction: Several friends (General Ivolgin, huntsman Kuzmich and Leva Soloveychik) decide to spend their vacation by fishing. Taking with themselves a large helping of vodka, they sail off, but quickly find themselves without much understanding as to their present location. Finally reaching some shore, which they mistakenly believe is still Russia, but which in reality happens to be neighboring Finland, they get off the ship and spend some time on the shore, eventually falling asleep. Not without the effect of previously consumed alcohol, the friends manage to forget their supplies of vodka as they sail off the shore. The quantity of forgotten goods being sizable (15 cases, with each case traditionally holding 20 bottles), they now face the challenging task of getting back their belongings, which now happen to reside across the border in a different country.
